definition: striding forward with head high (idiom); to walk with spirited and vigorous step/to strut
to lift/to raise/to raise one's head/high/high spirits/soaring/expensive
head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc
rich/wide/broad
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
surname Bu

sentences.english: He became a Congressman at the young age of 29 and brought his frontier swagger to the Senate a year later.
sentences.chinese: 他29歲成爲議員並在一年後昂首闊步進入參議院。

sentences.english: Peacocks strut in the surrounding meadow.
sentences.chinese: 孔雀在周圍的草地上昂首闊步。

sentences.english: They swept into the hall, preceded by trumpeters.
sentences.chinese: 他們以號手爲前導昂首闊步走進大廳。

sentences.english: He turned round about and stalked off.
sentences.chinese: 他向後一轉，昂首闊步地走開了。

sentences.english: We followed him, making great strides with head up.
sentences.chinese: 我們昂首闊步地跟着他向前走。

sentences.english: They strut and bounce, dance and flounce.
sentences.chinese: 他們昂首闊步，蹦蹦跳跳。

sentences.english: She said, “These women stood straight and suffered fewer falls.
sentences.chinese: 她表示化妝的女性走路時昂首闊步。

sentences.english: By wearing clothes that fit you well you’ll walk taller,straighter, exude confidence and just feel great.
sentences.chinese: 穿着合身的衣服，讓你昂首闊步，流露出無比的自信。

sentences.english: These young men are striding proudly ahead and advancing bravely.
sentences.chinese: 這些青年人正在昂首闊步奮勇前進。

sentences.english: By wearing clothes that fit you well you’ll walk taller, straighter, exude confidence and just feel great.
sentences.chinese: 穿着合身的衣服，讓你昂首闊步，流露出無比的自信。

sentences.english: The President, stern-faced with dignity, strutted toward the couple.
sentences.chinese: 這個校長，面無表情昂首闊步的走向這對夫婦。
他昂首闊步走上了主席臺。

sentences.english: The little boy put on his father's medals and strutted around the room.
sentences.chinese: 那小男孩戴止他父親的勳章，在房間內昂首闊步。

sentences.english: There was a rooster parading around the backyard and then there just wasn't.
sentences.chinese: 之前後院有隻大公雞昂首闊步，然後沒了，不見了。

definition: to prevail upon/to coax
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
to charge and break through enemy lines
dejected/despondent/depressed
equestrianism/horsemanship
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
Mao Sui recommends himself (idiom); to offer one's services (in the style of Mao Sui offering his services to king of Chu 楚 of the Warring states)
lit. to fall behind Sun Shan 孫山|孙山[Sun1 Shan1] (who came last in the imperial examination) (idiom)/fig. to fail an exam/to fall behind (in a competition)
anemone
to convert an enemy into a friend (idiom)
to surmount all difficulties (on the way to success) (idiom)/abbr. for 過五關斬六將|过五关斩六将[guo4 wu3 guan1 zhan3 liu4 jiang4]
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
red in the face/extremely angry
video program
grazing land/pasture
